Messages.Author: Frank Flechtner
Messages.Content: Dear students,  as discussed last lecture I would remind you on the following:  A homework will be provided till mid of July A successful homework is mandatory to be accepted for the oral exam! In total 100 points can be achieved; 50% is the expected minimum Homework result will be used for the final grade with a weight of 1:3 compared to the oral exam (see module description) Homework is due for September 10, 2024 (Provided as PDF in Email to frank.flechtner@tu-berlin.de). Results will be provided in time before the oral exam (planned for mid/end of October 2024) Those who have not yet confirmed that they would like to get their homework should do this till July 5!  Thanks and see you on Wednesday in my lecture  Frank Flechtner

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Zoom Link for Lecture on June 12

Messages.Author: Frank Flechtner
Messages.Content: Dear students, the Zoom link for Wednesday is https://tu-berlin.zoom.us/j/61871544931?pwd=LTkpb6lfRCeRZXVQnXvVyaAzI4w1Vc.1  The Meeting-ID is 618 7154 4931  I will start as usual at 8:30 s.t. I will continue with lecture 5 (gravity reductions) and then discuss material of lecture 6. Both lecture materials are availaable as PDF in ISIS. Best regards Frank Flechtner

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Lecture Physical Geodesy June 5 will be online!

Messages.Author: Frank Flechtner
Messages.Content: Dear students, due to the severe rainfall and related floods in Southern Germany it is currently impossible to go by train from Munich to Berlin. Therefore I needed to cancel my trip to Potsdam/Berlin this morning and the next lecture on June 5 needs to be online. I will start at 8:30 s.t. and we will discuss the material on normal potential, gravity reductions etc. which is already available in ISIS from last week. The link is: https://tu-berlin.zoom.us/j/68390296568?pwd=2ynGzrhPk4bEjUTeyQlrTTcSbRUy2o.1  The Meeting-ID is 683 9029 6568 Talk to you on Wednesday Frank Flechtner

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Lecture 5 Physical Geodesy on May 29 at 16:00

Messages.Author: Frank Flechtner
Messages.Content: Dear students, as discussed on Wednesday the lecture 5 on May 29 needs to be shifted to the afternoon as I have to be in Potsdam in the morning to celebrate "50 years of SLR on Telegraph Hill". The lecture will therefore start  on 16:00 s.t. and will be, as usual, in H6131. The lecture material for next week has just been uploaded. Please have a look! Best regards and have a nice weekend Frank Flechtner
